title: Polarization - satellite dish receives radio waves

content.prompt: A satellite dish is a receiver for radio waves emitted by a satellite in orbit around Earth. Which of the following correctly states whether the radio waves received by a satellite dish could be polarized, and provides evidence or reasoning that supports the statement?

choices.label: The radio waves could be polarized. The electric field of a radio wave is directed perpendicular to the wave’s direction of travel.
The radio waves could be polarized. The waves travel through the air before being detected, and air can only transmit transverse waves.
The radio waves cannot be polarized. The electric field of a radio wave is directed along the wave’s direction of travel.
The radio waves cannot be polarized. The waves travel through the air before being detected, and air can only transmit longitudinal waves.

topic.text: 14.3: Boundary Behavior of Waves and Polarization

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
